title: Google\Cloud\ServiceControl\V1\QuotaOperation
name: QuotaOperation
description:
Represents information regarding a quota operation.

Generated from protobuf message google.api.servicecontrol.v1.QuotaOperation

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.operation_id
params.description: Identity of the operation. This is expected to be unique within the scope of the service that generated the operation, and guarantees idempotency in case of retries. In order to ensure best performance and latency in the Quota backends, operation_ids are optimally associated with time, so that related operations can be accessed fast in storage. For this reason, the recommended token for services that intend to operate at a high QPS is Unix time in nanos + UUID

params.name: data.method_name
params.description: Fully qualified name of the API method for which this quota operation is requested. This name is used for matching quota rules or metric rules and billing status rules defined in service configuration. This field should not be set if any of the following is true: (1) the quota operation is performed on non-API resources. (2) quota_metrics is set because the caller is doing quota override. Example of an RPC method name: google.example.library.v1.LibraryService.CreateShelf

params.name: data.consumer_id
params.description: Identity of the consumer for whom this quota operation is being performed. This can be in one of the following formats: project:, project_number:, api_key:.

params.name: data.quota_metrics
params.description: Represents information about this operation. Each MetricValueSet corresponds to a metric defined in the service configuration. The data type used in the MetricValueSet must agree with the data type specified in the metric definition. Within a single operation, it is not allowed to have more than one MetricValue instances that have the same metric names and identical label value combinations. If a request has such duplicated MetricValue instances, the entire request is rejected with an invalid argument error. This field is mutually exclusive with method_name.

methods.name: getQuotaMetrics
methods.description:
Represents information about this operation. Each MetricValueSet corresponds to a metric defined in the service configuration.

The data type used in the MetricValueSet must agree with the data type specified in the metric definition. Within a single operation, it is not allowed to have more than one MetricValue instances that have the same metric names and identical label value combinations.
